channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes broken & sunken road surface 2, 10th April
item.description:
You've reported as fixed today ? - but - you've done more work in the middle section of Malden Rd & nothing in the top section as requested (& described) in the original report? The original request still stands:The road surface has seriously deteriorated along the length of Malden Road (section nearest to the the Pump Room) and multiple potholes have developed. The road has also sunk along one side and surface has broken up causing a hazard. I turned an ankle last week. A small number of potholes have been marked for repair recently, however, as can be seen from the photos attached they are only a small number & ignore the multiple & massive sunken areas adjacent that collect water & continue to degrade the surface. It is clear the road needs levelling & resurfacing along the length - as has been completed in the adjacent middle section of Malden Road which was previously in a better state of repair that this? A short term fix to 'patch' those marked will only result in further work in a very short space of time. Many Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Malden Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole road is appalling, 9th April

item.title: It is a Danger to Cyclist as they have avoid it and to other road users, also when lorries or cars/ vans with trailers go over it there is loud noise and the trailers make noise as well. With the work going on at the airballoon road improvements and the various overnight road closures it means more traffic thoughtout the night making a noise keeping people awake., 9th April
item.description:
It is on the Cirencester Road right on the Bafford Approach turning. (the inward to Bafford Approach side of the road) It is between the main road and the white line into Bafford Approach

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bafford Approach, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple gigantic potholes for approx 500 m from Prestbury road to Cromwell road, 9th April
item.description:
Multiple gigantic potholes on priors road. Stretching from Prestbury road to Cromwell road. Approximately 500m long. Only 1 tiny hole was fixed in march 2024
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Complete failure of road surface, 9th April
item.description:
Long stretch between Prestbury Road & Cromwell Road. In areas it is causing dangerous vehicle evasive action. The surface deterioration is very wide in areas and the original concrete road surface is visible. Considering the road was resurfaced in the last 15 years this is unacceptable and needs to be rectified urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 256, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rather large square sort of hole, 9th April
item.description:
This pothole has appeared near the kerb edge in the road outside where the big Plylon is situated quite deep full of water today difficult to avoid if large lorries coming on the opposite side of the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Runnings Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is dead and now rotting towards private address, The tree is located outside no 38 Norfolk avenue. The tree didn't grow leafs last year and the trunk is looking more rotten, 9th April

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Norfolk Avenue, Rowanfield, Cheltenham

item.title: Crossing audible sound too loud/soft problem, 9th April
item.description:
email rec 26/03/2024 - Dear Sirs, this is an email update to enquire when our pedestrian access will be working on the Moorend Park Road/Shurdington Road two way junction. The buttons have been out of action now for 5 days. Please treat this as priority as there are many retired/elderly residents living around here. Some of us have mobility issues and its difficult trying to cross a busy junction.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Block drain and pipe, 9th April
item.description:
A council lorry with a tube to suck out water came today but they did not clear the blockage . The drain is still over flowing . We spoke to the men and I think the pipe under ground is blocked
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Noverton Lane, Tewkesbury
